alert.note: Alert for Genesee; Niagara; Northern Erie (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 5:31PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...A line of strong thunderstorms stretching from Grand Island east to Clarence Center will slowly move east southeast impacting portions of northern Erie, southern Niagara and western Genesee Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 530 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking an areas of strong thunderstorms from Grand Island to near Clarence, moving east southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Cheektowaga, North Tonawanda, Clarence, Amherst, Tonawanda, Williamsville, Darien Lakes State Park, Grand Island, Pendleton, Pembroke, Akron, Alden, Oakfield, Sanborn, Corfu, Clarence Center, Pendleton Center, East Amherst, Rapids and East Pembroke. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 48A and 49. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
